refnamediv.refpurpose: return the address of the specified pointer

listitem.para: Specifies the array or buffer pointer to be returned. Symbolic constants GL_COLOR_ARRAY_POINTER, GL_EDGE_FLAG_ARRAY_POINTER, GL_FOG_COORDINATE_ARRAY_POINTER, GL_FEEDBACK_BUFFER_POINTER, GL_INDEX_ARRAY_POINTER, GL_NORMAL_ARRAY_POINTER, GL_SECONDARY_COLOR_ARRAY_POINTER, GL_SELECTION_BUFFER_POINTER, GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY_POINTER, and GL_VERTEX_ARRAY_POINTER are accepted.
Returns the pointer value specified by pname.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: glGetPointerv returns pointer information. pname is a symbolic constant indicating the pointer to be returned, and params is a pointer to a location in which to place the returned data.

refsect1.title: NOTES
refsect1.para: glGetPointerv is available only if the GL version is 1.1 or greater.
GL_FOG_COORDINATE_ARRAY_POINTER is available only if the GL version is 1.4 or greater.
The pointers are all client-side state.
The initial value for each pointer is 0.
For OpenGL versions 1.3 and greater, or when the ARB_multitexture extension is supported, querying the GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY_POINTER returns the value for the active client texture unit.

refsect1.title: ERRORS
refsect1.para: GL_INVALID_ENUM is generated if pname is not an accepted value.
